posts.post_content: The only reason I could see anyone using [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel) over this is to use things in the opponent's graveyard, with sorceries like [Spelltwine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spelltwine). Cancel wouldn't be so bad if it was just 2![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) instead of 1![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol). In most situations however, Dissipate is a straight upgrade to Cancel.
posts.html:
The only reason I could see anyone using Cancel over this is to use things in the opponent's graveyard, with sorceries like Spelltwine. Cancel wouldn't be so bad if it was just 2 instead of 1. In most situations however, Dissipate is a straight upgrade to Cancel.

Posted By: Continue (11/2/2012 7:25:48 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Everything rains on the Golgari shitfarm.   
  
**Selesnya**  
Bigger more efficient creatures than the swarm can handle, as well as access to [Rest in Peace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rest in Peace).  
  
**Azorius**  
Also have access to Rest in Peace, but also get [Detention Sphere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Detention Sphere), and the mother of board wipes, [Supreme Verdict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Supreme Verdict).  
  
**Izzet**  
[Annihilating Fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Annihilating Fire), this, as well as [Mizzium Mortars](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mizzium Mortars) for a boardwipe.  
  
**Rakdos**  
[Rakdos Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rakdos Charm) exiles graveyards, and they put the hurt on faster than Golgari can defend it, much less set up.  
  
Aside from a few gems, Golgari got shafted this set.
posts.html:
Everything rains on the Golgari shitfarm.

Selesnya
Bigger more efficient creatures than the swarm can handle, as well as access to Rest in Peace.

Azorius
Also have access to Rest in Peace, but also get Detention Sphere, and the mother of board wipes, Supreme Verdict.

Izzet
Annihilating Fire, this, as well as Mizzium Mortars for a boardwipe.

Rakdos
Rakdos Charm exiles graveyards, and they put the hurt on faster than Golgari can defend it, much less set up.

Aside from a few gems, Golgari got shafted this set.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: StreamHopper (10/2/2012 12:42:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This isn't 'strictly better' than cancel, I really wish you people would stop using that.  
  
It's situational. The most obvious would be if you're playing a deck that runs on your opponent's graveyard, you wouldn't want his spells to get exiled, as you then wouldn't get any use from them.  
  
Strictly better would be [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) vs [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel). They do the same exact thing, only CS is ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) cheaper. This has the same CMC as Cancel, and serves a specific purpose, just like [Hinder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hinder).
posts.html:
This isn't 'strictly better' than cancel, I really wish you people would stop using that.

It's situational. The most obvious would be if you're playing a deck that runs on your opponent's graveyard, you wouldn't want his spells to get exiled, as you then wouldn't get any use from them.

Strictly better would be Counterspell vs Cancel. They do the same exact thing, only CS is cheaper. This has the same CMC as Cancel, and serves a specific purpose, just like Hinder.

Posted By: Floorsweeper (4/20/2013 5:50:22 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @Kasaiaisu: That scenario is ridiculously convoluted. In 99.9% of situations, [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) will be better than [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel). Just because once in a thousand games in a certain deck, Cancel might be a little better does not make it any better than [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell).
posts.html:
@Kasaiaisu: That scenario is ridiculously convoluted. In 99.9% of situations, Counterspell will be better than Cancel. Just because once in a thousand games in a certain deck, Cancel might be a little better does not make it any better than Counterspell.

Posted By: Lifegainwithbite (5/11/2013 7:58:37 AM)
Rating:

@ifegainwithbite
Yes, Counterspell is better than Cancel 99.9% of the time. However, it is not strictly better... sometimes having a higher CMC is beneficial, as in the case of transmute cards, counterbalance, spellbound dragon, and so on.

Seriously, people, learn what the words "strictly better" means. See Shock vs Lightning Bolt. where the only time that you would want shock over LB is if your opponent plays Meddling Mage and names Lightning bolt. Same with Greatsword vs Vulshok Battlegear
